Column Comment.0: ANALYSIS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample analysis. Various types ofanalysis may be conducted on a sample. Samples may be derived from lithologiccuttings, fluid collection etc.
Column Comment.1: ANALYSIS SOURCE: The source that the analysis came from, this could be a labtechnician, a lab, a company, a government agency, etc.
Column Comment.2: SAMPLE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a sample used in technical analysis.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: BATCH IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the batch or collection of samples that arerun through an analysis at the same time for comparative purposes. Informationabout which samples are part of a batch provides important information aboutinstrument calibration, results comparison, identification of problems and more.
Column Comment.5: CREATED BY STEP INDICATOR: indicates that this sample was created during theanalysis step, such as fractionation.
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.7: END DATE: The date on which this analysis ended.
Column Comment.8: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.11: SAMPLE DESCRIPTION: A narrative description about the sample used for analysis.Detailed and structured information about the sample, its collection and storage arefound in the tables named SAMPLE_%. This column should only be used to storenarrative unstructured comments about samples received in lab reports.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.13: STANDARD SAMPLE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether or not the sampleis a standard.
Column Comment.14: STEP SEQUENCE NUMBER: A unique number indicating the sequence of the stepamong other steps in the analysis of the sample.
Column Comment.15: USED BY STEP INDICATOR: indicates that this sample was used during theanalysis step.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
